name: 野生動物學
description: This course covers the fundamental concepts of wildlife biology, and introduces practical tools and classic cases in wildlife conservation and management.
goals: Students will become familiar with fundamental concepts of wildlife biology, as well as practical tools used in wildlife conservation and management.
Students will put the knowledge they learned towards an independent project, which they present in class.
syllabus:
##### Weeks 1-8: Wildlife biology and ecology

1.Introduction

2-3. Individual ecology

4-5. Population dynamics

6-7. Species interaction

8.Climate change and wildlife

##### Weeks 9-14: Wildlife conservation and management

9.Counting animals

10.Demographic structure

11.Population viability analysis

12.Conservation genetics

13.Meta-population dynamics

14.Wildlife conservation and management in the context of ecosystem

##### Weeks 15-18: Group project presentation (or special topic lectures)
